sentence.Network_cn: 多数客人至少去过一次城里。

sentence.Network_cn: 去一趟超市就可以将一次完美野餐所需的现成食物置办妥当。

list.abs: BMW's foray into the world of hybrids is expected to begin at point this year with the release of a hybrid variant of the 7-series flagship and eventually the X5 and X6 SUVs as well .宝马进军世界杂交预计将于在某个时候，今年释放了混合变异的7系列的旗舰，并最终在X5和X6越野车以及。
the company ' s first foray into the computer market ., 该公司打入计算机市场的首次尝试.
an actor ' s foray into politics ., 演员对政治的尝试性介入.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: back-formation from forayer 'a person who forays', from Old French forrier 'forager', from fuerre 'straw' (see forage)

entry.def: If you make a foray into a new or unfamiliar type of activity, you start to become involved in it.

example.ex: Emporio Armani, the Italian fashion house, has made a discreet foray into furnishings.
example.tran: 意大利时装品牌安普里奥·阿玛尼谨慎进入家居用品市场。

entry.def: You can refer to a short journey that you make as a foray if it seems to involve excitement or risk, for example because it is to an unfamiliar place or because you are looking for a particular thing.

example.ex: Most guests make at least one foray into the town...
example.tran: 多数客人至少去过一次城里。

example.ex: A foray to your supermarket will supply all the ready-made foods for an excellent picnic.
example.tran: 去一趟超市就可以将一次完美野餐所需的现成食物置办妥当。

entry.def: If a group of soldiers make a foray into enemy territory, they make a quick attack there, and then return to their own territory.

example.ex: These base camps were used by the PKK guerrillas to make forays into Turkey.
example.tran: 这些基地训练营被库尔德工人党游击队用于对土耳其实施突袭行动。

means.word_mean: 2. an initial attempt (especially outside your usual areas of competence);

sentences.sentence: "During the earthquake people looted the stores that were deserted by their owners"
